citation.article-title: Kribbella karoonensis sp. nov. and Kribbella swartbergensis sp. nov., isolated from soil from the Western Cape, South Africa
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Kribbella swartbergensis sp. nov.
Kribbella swartbergensis (swart′berg.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. swartbergensis pertaining to the Groot Swartberg mountain range, South Africa).
Gram-positive.
Aerobic.
Aerial mycelium is white and the vegetative hyphae are cream-coloured on inorganic salts/starch agar (ISP 4).
Hyphae fragment into rod-shaped elements in broth and on agar.
No diffusible pigments are produced on glycerol-asparagine agar (ISP 5).
Melanin pigment is not produced on peptone-yeast extract-iron agar (ISP 6) or tyrosine agar (ISP 7).
Nitrate is reduced.
Catalase-positive.
Produces H2S.

Utilizes d(−)-fructose, d(+)-glucose, maltose, d(+)-melibiose, d(−)-sorbitol and sucrose as sole carbon sources, with weak growth on l(+)-arabinose, glycerol, myo-inositol, lactose, d-mannitol, d(+)-mannose, raffinose, l(+)-rhamnose, sodium acetate, sodium citrate, sodium lactate, sodium succinate and d(+)-xylose after 21 days.
Grows at 20–45 °C.
Grows at pH 7 and 9.
Aesculin, arbutin and starch are hydrolysed.
Degrades adenine, casein, gelatin, hypoxanthine, Tween 80 and l-tyrosine.
Grows well on ISP 2 medium in the presence of 3 % NaCl, with weak growth at 4 % NaCl.

Grows in the presence of carbenicillin disodium salt (100 μg ml−1), cephaloridine (10 μg ml−1), chloramphenicol (20 μg ml−1), cycloheximide (10 μg ml−1), erythromycin (10 μg ml−1), gentamicin sulphate (10 μg ml−1), neomycin sulphate (10 μg ml−1) and streptomycin sulphate (10 μg ml−1) The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains ll-diaminopimelic acid and glycine (chemotype I).
The whole-cell sugars are ribose and mannose.
The type strain, HMC25T (=NRRL B-24426T=DSM 17345T), was isolated from soil from the banks of the River Gamka, Die Hel, Groot Swartberg mountain range, Western Cape province, South Africa.
